26#include <sys/cdefs.h>
27__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: nouveau_nvkm_subdev_mmu_nv44.c,v 1.3 2018/08/27 07:41:09 riastradh Exp $");
28
29#include "nv04.h"
30
31#include <core/gpuobj.h>
32#include <core/option.h>
33#include <subdev/timer.h>
34
35#define NV44_GART_SIZE (512 * 1024 * 1024)
36#define NV44_GART_PAGE ( 4 * 1024)
37
38/*******************************************************************************
39 * VM map/unmap callbacks
40 ******************************************************************************/
41
42static void
43nv44_vm_fill(struct nvkm_memory *pgt, dma_addr_t null,
44 dma_addr_t *list, u32 pte, u32 cnt)
45{
46 u32 base = (pte << 2) & ~0x0000000f;
47 u32 tmp[4];
48
49 tmp[0] = nvkm_ro32(pgt, base + 0x0);
50 tmp[1] = nvkm_ro32(pgt, base + 0x4);
51 tmp[2] = nvkm_ro32(pgt, base + 0x8);
52 tmp[3] = nvkm_ro32(pgt, base + 0xc);
53
54 while (cnt--) {
55 u32 addr = list ? (*list++ >> 12) : (null >> 12);
56 switch (pte++ & 0x3) {
57 case 0:
58 tmp[0] &= ~0x07ffffff;
59 tmp[0] |= addr;
60 break;
61 case 1:
62 tmp[0] &= ~0xf8000000;
63 tmp[0] |= addr << 27;
64 tmp[1] &= ~0x003fffff;
65 tmp[1] |= addr >> 5;
66 break;
67 case 2:
68 tmp[1] &= ~0xffc00000;
69 tmp[1] |= addr << 22;
70 tmp[2] &= ~0x0001ffff;
71 tmp[2] |= addr >> 10;
72 break;
73 case 3:
74 tmp[2] &= ~0xfffe0000;
75 tmp[2] |= addr << 17;
76 tmp[3] &= ~0x00000fff;
77 tmp[3] |= addr >> 15;
78 break;
79 }
80 }
81
82 nvkm_wo32(pgt, base + 0x0, tmp[0]);
83 nvkm_wo32(pgt, base + 0x4, tmp[1]);
84 nvkm_wo32(pgt, base + 0x8, tmp[2]);
85 nvkm_wo32(pgt, base + 0xc, tmp[3] | 0x40000000);
86}
87
88static void
89nv44_vm_map_sg(struct nvkm_vma *vma, struct nvkm_memory *pgt,
90 struct nvkm_mem *mem, u32 pte, u32 cnt, dma_addr_t *list)
91{
92 struct nv04_mmu *mmu = nv04_mmu(vma->vm->mmu);
93 u32 tmp[4];
94 int i;
95
96 nvkm_kmap(pgt);
97 if (pte & 3) {
98 u32 max = 4 - (pte & 3);
99 u32 part = (cnt > max) ? max : cnt;
100 nv44_vm_fill(pgt, mmu->null, list, pte, part);
101 pte += part;
102 list += part;
103 cnt -= part;
104 }
105
106 while (cnt >= 4) {
107 for (i = 0; i < 4; i++)
108 tmp[i] = *list++ >> 12;
109 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte++ * 4, tmp[0] >> 0 | tmp[1] << 27);
110 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte++ * 4, tmp[1] >> 5 | tmp[2] << 22);
111 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte++ * 4, tmp[2] >> 10 | tmp[3] << 17);
112 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte++ * 4, tmp[3] >> 15 | 0x40000000);
113 cnt -= 4;
114 }
115
116 if (cnt)
117 nv44_vm_fill(pgt, mmu->null, list, pte, cnt);
118 nvkm_done(pgt);
119}
120
121static void
122nv44_vm_unmap(struct nvkm_vma *vma, struct nvkm_memory *pgt, u32 pte, u32 cnt)
123{
124 struct nv04_mmu *mmu = nv04_mmu(vma->vm->mmu);
125
126 nvkm_kmap(pgt);
127 if (pte & 3) {
128 u32 max = 4 - (pte & 3);
129 u32 part = (cnt > max) ? max : cnt;
130 nv44_vm_fill(pgt, mmu->null, NULL, pte, part);
131 pte += part;
132 cnt -= part;
133 }
134
135 while (cnt >= 4) {
136 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte++ * 4, 0x00000000);
137 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte++ * 4, 0x00000000);
138 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte++ * 4, 0x00000000);
139 nvkm_wo32(pgt, pte++ * 4, 0x00000000);
140 cnt -= 4;
141 }
142
143 if (cnt)
144 nv44_vm_fill(pgt, mmu->null, NULL, pte, cnt);
145 nvkm_done(pgt);
146}
147
148static void
149nv44_vm_flush(struct nvkm_vm *vm)
150{
151 struct nv04_mmu *mmu = nv04_mmu(vm->mmu);
152 struct nvkm_device *device = mmu->base.subdev.device;
153 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x100814, mmu->base.limit - NV44_GART_PAGE);
154 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x100808, 0x00000020);
155 nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
156 if (nvkm_rd32(device, 0x100808) & 0x00000001)
157 break;
158 );
159 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x100808, 0x00000000);
160}
161
162/*******************************************************************************
163 * MMU subdev
164 ******************************************************************************/
165
166static int
167nv44_mmu_oneinit(struct nvkm_mmu *base)
168{
169 struct nv04_mmu *mmu = nv04_mmu(base);
170 struct nvkm_device *device = mmu->base.subdev.device;
171 int ret;
172
173#ifdef __NetBSD__
174 do {
175 const bus_dma_tag_t dmat = device->func->dma_tag(device);
176 const unsigned nullsz = 16 * 1024;
177 int nsegs;
178
179 /* XXX errno NetBSD->Linux */
180 ret = -bus_dmamem_alloc(dmat, nullsz, PAGE_SIZE, 0,
181 &mmu->nullseg, 1, &nsegs, BUS_DMA_WAITOK);
182 if (ret)
183fail0: break;
184 KASSERT(nsegs == 1);
185
186 /* XXX errno NetBSD->Linux */
187 ret = -bus_dmamap_create(dmat, nullsz /* size */, 1 /* maxnseg */,
188 nullsz /* maxsegsz */, 0, BUS_DMA_WAITOK, &mmu->nullmap);
189 if (ret) {
190fail1: bus_dmamem_free(dmat, &mmu->nullseg, 1);
191 goto fail0;
192 }
193
194 /* XXX errno NetBSD->Linux */
195 ret = -bus_dmamem_map(dmat, &mmu->nullseg, 1, nullsz,
196 &mmu->nullp, BUS_DMA_WAITOK);
197 if (ret) {
198fail2: bus_dmamap_destroy(dmat, mmu->nullmap);
199 goto fail1;
200 }
201
202 /* XXX errno NetBSD->Linux */
203 ret = -bus_dmamap_load(dmat, mmu->nullmap, mmu->nullp, nullsz,
204 NULL, BUS_DMA_WAITOK);
205 if (ret) {
206fail3: __unused bus_dmamem_unmap(dmat, mmu->nullp, nullsz);
207 goto fail2;
208 }
209 mmu->null = mmu->nullmap->dm_segs[0].ds_addr;
210 } while (0);
211#else
212 mmu->nullp = dma_alloc_coherent(device->dev, 16 * 1024,
213 &mmu->null, GFP_KERNEL);
214#endif
215 if (!mmu->nullp) {
216 nvkm_warn(&mmu->base.subdev, "unable to allocate dummy pages\n");
217 mmu->null = 0;
218 }
219
220 ret = nvkm_vm_create(&mmu->base, 0, NV44_GART_SIZE, 0, 4096, NULL,
221 &mmu->vm);
222 if (ret)
223 return ret;
224
225 ret = nvkm_memory_new(device, NVKM_MEM_TARGET_INST,
226 (NV44_GART_SIZE / NV44_GART_PAGE) * 4,
227 512 * 1024, true,
228 &mmu->vm->pgt[0].mem[0]);
229 mmu->vm->pgt[0].refcount[0] = 1;
230 return ret;
231}
232
233static void
234nv44_mmu_init(struct nvkm_mmu *base)
235{
236 struct nv04_mmu *mmu = nv04_mmu(base);
237 struct nvkm_device *device = mmu->base.subdev.device;
238 struct nvkm_memory *gart = mmu->vm->pgt[0].mem[0];
239 u32 addr;
240
241 /* calculate vram address of this PRAMIN block, object must be
242 * allocated on 512KiB alignment, and not exceed a total size
243 * of 512KiB for this to work correctly
244 */
245 addr = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10020c);
246 addr -= ((nvkm_memory_addr(gart) >> 19) + 1) << 19;
247
248 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x100850, 0x80000000);
249 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x100818, mmu->null);
250 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x100804, NV44_GART_SIZE);
251 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x100850, 0x00008000);
252 nvkm_mask(device, 0x10008c, 0x00000200, 0x00000200);
253 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x100820, 0x00000000);
254 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x10082c, 0x00000001);
255 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x100800, addr | 0x00000010);
256}
257
258static const struct nvkm_mmu_func
259nv44_mmu = {
260 .dtor = nv04_mmu_dtor,
261 .oneinit = nv44_mmu_oneinit,
262 .init = nv44_mmu_init,
263 .limit = NV44_GART_SIZE,
264 .dma_bits = 39,
265 .pgt_bits = 32 - 12,
266 .spg_shift = 12,
267 .lpg_shift = 12,
268 .map_sg = nv44_vm_map_sg,
269 .unmap = nv44_vm_unmap,
270 .flush = nv44_vm_flush,
271};
272
273int
274nv44_mmu_new(struct nvkm_device *device, int index, struct nvkm_mmu **pmmu)
275{
276 if (device->type == NVKM_DEVICE_AGP ||
277 !nvkm_boolopt(device->cfgopt, "NvPCIE", true))
278 return nv04_mmu_new(device, index, pmmu);
279
280 return nv04_mmu_new_(&nv44_mmu, device, index, pmmu);
281}
